properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Extremely cold temperatures below -40 and windchills near -50 are possible this evening. Warmer air aloft with some clouds should cause the temperature to rise overnight, so this warning should be short-lived. ### Extreme cold puts everyone at risk. Risks are greater for young children, older adults, people with chronic illnesses, people working or exercising outdoors, and those without proper shelter. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NTStorm.
Expires: 2020-12-14T16:00:00-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-12-14T01:22:00-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3934425367.2020
Area: Norman Wells - Tulita Region, Fort Good Hope Region

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow at times heavy persists this evening. An additional 5 to 10 cm of snow is expected in addition of the snowfall amounts of 10 cm received since Saturday evening. Blowing snow is possible in areas exposed to the winds. Weather conditions will improve gradually overnight tonight. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-12-14T13:59:20-00:00

properties.Title: Smog Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: High concentrations of pollutants are expected and will result in poor air quality. High levels of pollutants are expected to diminish Monday morning. ### Smog especially affects asthmatic children and people with respiratory ailments or heart disease. It is therefore recommended that these individuals avoid intense physical activity outdoors until the smog warning is lifted. In Quebec, wood heating is the main source of fine particles that contribute to smog during winter. This activity generates the largest number of these particulates, more than industrial activities and transportation. Additional information: To learn more about the Info-Smog program, go to Environment Canada’s website at www.canada.ca/info-smog-program. For air quality indexes in Quebec, visit the website of the Ministère de l'Environnement et de la Lutte contre les changements climatiques at www.iqa.environnement.gouv.qc.ca/contenu/index_en.asp. For the air quality index in Montréal, visit the Réseau de surveillance de la qualité de l’air de la Ville de Montréal’s website at www.rsqa.qc.ca (french only). To learn more about the effects of smog on your health in Québec, visit the Ministère de la Santé et des Services sociaux’s website at www.quebec.ca/en/health. You can also visit the Direction régionale de santé publique du CIUSSS du Centre-Sud-de-l’Île-de-Montréal at www.santemontreal.qc.ca/en/public. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2020-12-14T21:05:15-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the Ministère de l'Environnement et de la Lutte contre les changements climatiques, the Ministère de la Santé et des Services sociaux, the Direction régionale de santé publique du CIUSSS du Centre-Sud-de-l’Île-de-Montréal, the City of Montréal, 2020-12-14T03:17:15-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0568806137.2020
Area: La Sarre area, Amos area, Lebel-sur-Quévillon area, Senneterre area, Rouyn area, Malartic area, Val d'Or - Louvicourt area
properties.Author: Environment Canada, the Ministère de l'Environnement et de la Lutte contre les changements climatiques, the Ministère de la Santé et des Services sociaux, the Direction régionale de santé publique du CIUSSS du Centre-Sud-de-l’Île-de-Montréal, the City of Montréal

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. Snow giving total accumulations of 20 to 30 cm is expected. Strong winds combined with the snow will reduce visibilities to zero in the blowing snow. Weather conditions will improve Monday morning. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Winter storm warnings are issued when multiple types of severe winter weather are expected to occur together. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-12-14T16:59:14-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-12-14T03:38:14-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3498894269.2020
Area: Forestville area, Les Escoumins area, Baie-Comeau, Baie-Trinité area, Sept-Îles - Port-Cartier area
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant snowfall expected beginning Tuesday. Locations: coastal Labrador and the Eagle River area. Time span: Tuesday and Wednesday. Remarks: Snow, at times heavy, and strong easterly winds are expected to spread across coastal Labrador on Tuesday. While it is too soon to provide specific details, the potential exists for significant snowfall mid week. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-12-14T18:15:06-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-12-14T02:16:06-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3883041761.2020

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snow Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow squalls are expected to develop. Under the snow squall bands, visibilities will be significantly reduced due to the heavy snow combined with blowing snow, and snow will quickly accumulate. Conditions may be favourable for snow squalls to develop off of Lake Superior Monday afternoon and Monday evening. Snowfall amounts near 15 cm are possible. Poor winter driving conditions from sudden low visibility in bursts of heavy snow and blowing snow are possible beginning Monday afternoon. ### Snow squalls cause weather conditions to vary considerably; changes from clear skies to heavy snow within just a few kilometres are common. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-12-14T20:23:56-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-12-14T04:24:56-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1967338880.2020
Area: Searchmont - Montreal River Harbour - Batchawana Bay, Sault Ste. Marie - St. Joseph Island
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions near the Richardson Mountains expected to continue through Monday afternoon. Easterly winds near 90 km/h are combining with loose snow to reduce visibility to 400 metres or less near the Richardson Mountains. Blowing snow giving reduced visibility is likely along the rest of the route. This blizzard is expected to continue through most of Monday. Conditions are expected to improve Monday evening. ### Travel is expected to be very difficult or impossible due to near-zero visibility. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #YTStorm.
Expires: 2020-12-14T15:11:57-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-12-13T23:12:57-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2588599231.2020
Area: Dempster

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Potential winter storm mid week. Locations: Newfoundland. Time span: Tuesday and Wednesday. Maximum wind gusts: westerly 80 km/h with higher gusts likely along coastal areas. Remarks: A storm will track towards Newfoundland Monday night. While it is too soon to provide specific details, the potential exists for strong winds accompanied by significant amounts of snow or rain. Snow and snowsqualls are expected for western and northern Newfoundland, while mainly rain is expected in the east. Central areas may see a change from snow to rain throughout this event. Additional information will be provided as the details become more certain. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-12-14T18:10:42-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-12-14T02:11:42-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0858558418.2020

properties.Title: Weather Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winter Weather Travel Advisory in effect for tonight. Snow briefly heavy at times is expected tonight in areas extending from near Marathon to Montreal River Harbour. Snowfall amounts of 5 to 10 cm are likely with 10 to 15 cm possible in a few localities. Poor winter driving conditions from low visibility and accumulating snow on untreated highways are expected to develop this evening. Conditions are expected to improve by Monday morning after the snow tapers off to scattered flurries. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-12-14T15:59:35-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-12-14T04:24:35-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2543227442.2020

properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A period of very cold wind chills is expected. Wind chill values at Taloyoak are expected to drop to -55 tonight as the skies will remain clear with light northerly winds. Temperatures are expected to moderate slightly on Monday afternoon but are forecast to plummet again Monday evening giving windchill values well below -55 in Gjoa Haven, Kugaaruk, and Taloyoak. ### Risks are greater for young children, older adults, people with chronic illnesses, people working or exercising outdoors, and those without proper shelter. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.

Area: Taloyoak

properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A period of very cold wind chills is expected. Clear skies and relatively light winds will cause the temperature to plummet Sunday night to -40 degrees Celsius. Wind chill values are expected to reach -50 by Monday morning. Temperatures will moderate slightly Monday afternoon, and cloud cover on Monday night should keep the extreme cold from returning. ### Extreme cold puts everyone at risk. Risks are greater for young children, older adults, people with chronic illnesses, people working or exercising outdoors, and those without proper shelter. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NTStorm.

properties.Title: Amber Alert Ended Children Has Been Found
properties.Summary:
Description: This is an AMBER alert. This alert issued by the Provincial Police is in effect for: Province of Quebec. Two children, Dayana Di Menna, seven years old, 1 meter 4, brown eyes and brown hairs, and Liana Di Menna, two years old, 76 centimetres, blond hairs and green borown eyes, wearing a red and white legging have been abducted in Terrebonne decembre 13th at 3 p.m. by Jessica Kate Boulet, 34 years old. They were last seen in a blue Land Rover Discovery car, 2019, plate F M V 6 8 2 3.
Expires: 2020-12-14T18:00:00-04:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Ministère de la Sécurité publique du Québec, 2020-12-13T20:26:06-04:00, 70170C5B-2771-4075-AB31-3DA07F1153CB
Area: Province of Quebec
properties.Author: Ministère de la Sécurité publique du Québec
